titleInfo.title: Coll 30/156 'Bahrein: Education of Sheikh's son. Visit to England.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 15; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file concerns the visit to England of Shaikh Abdullah bin Hamad [‘Abdullāh bin Ḥamad Āl Khalīfah], son of Shaikh Hamad bin Isa al Khalifah [Ḥamad bin ‘Īsá Āl Khalīfah], Ruler of Bahrain. The purpose of the visit was to enable Shaikh Abdullah to acquire a good knowledge of English. The papers include a letter proposing the visit from Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, Adviser to the Ruler of Bahrain, and some details of Shaikh Abdullah's residence in England with a private tutor in Oxford (Lieutenant-Colonel Henry Hosking Gordon Browne).The file includes a divider, which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
